page.title: 09Public Services
page.content: {Telephone}subscribers in the area have national and international links, plus access to a wide range of recorded information. The local exchange is in South Walks, Dorchester. {Gas}from the North Sea is available to most buildings in Dorchester. Few of the villages in our square have mains gas. Most homes have mains{electricity which is supplied through substations and pole transformers in Dorchester. West Dorset District Council maintains all{sewers}and most pumping stations under agreement with the Wessex Water Authority, which is also responsible for such{water services}as development of resources, treatment, supply and distribution. WDDC provide a weekly kerbside{refuse {collection,}but for the old or infirm, it may be from the house. Estimated cost was 19p per bin per week in 1984.
